Description: A tall, narrow jar of coarse red siltware pottery, with a pointed base. The sides rise almost vertically, with a slight narrowing at the mid-point, to a rounded shoulder. From this they converge to a narrow mouth, which is surrounded by a low, external rim. The exterior of the jar bears remains of a polished red slip. The fabric contains a fair amount of grit and shows marks of burnt-out straw temper.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (D), chamber 22
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 22 has been scratched into the side of the jar.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64, 65, 67 § 61, pl. xxxiv, 24)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.94, p.105, p.134, p.193, pl.35, p.217, pl.59)
